result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Paul Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.
**If defendant completes one of these degrees while serving his time the Court orders 3 months off of the conditional jail time.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. May take prescriptions according to Dr.'s orders.
No contact with A.L. or any children until parenting classes have been completed.
No contact with known drug users, dealers or drug houses.

Complete any assessments and treatments as recommended by agent.
Complete parenting classes/program as approved by ADAPT.
Participate in and successfully complete Anger Management Program and Cognitive Intervention Program.
Take part in personal counseling.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
**See Employment/School section.**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
